Package cs2030.simulator

Class Customer

java.lang.Object
cs2030.simulator.Customer
public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
Customer that can be served by a Server. Supports states and setters for these states, getters, and the waitsAt and servedAt methods which return a new customer with the appropriate state and time.

  • Constructor Summary

    Instantiates a new Customer with the arguments as parameters.

  • Constructor Details

    • Customer

      public Customer​(int id, double time, java.lang.String state, boolean isGreedy)
      Instantiates a customer with the arguments as parameters.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the customer.
      time - Timestamp of the last update of the state of the Customer.
      state - Current state of the customer.
      isGreedy - Boolean to check if the customer is a greedy customer.

    • Customer

      public Customer​(int id, double time, java.lang.String state, boolean selfCheck, int serverID, int waitingID, double entryTime, double servedTime, double completedTime, boolean isGreedy)
      Instantiates a new Customer with the arguments as parameters.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the customer.
      time - Timestamp of the last update of the state of the Customer.
      state - Current state of the customer.
      selfCheck - Boolean to check if the customer is waiting/served by a self-check station.
      serverID - ID of the server which the customer is being served by.
      waitingID - ID of the server which the customer is waiting for.
      entryTime - Time of arrival. Used for computing statistics.
      servedTime - Time of service. Used for computing statistics.
      completedTime - Time of completion (DONE). Used for computing statistics.
      isGreedy - Boolean to check if the customer is a greedy customer.

    • arrivesAt

      public static Customer arrivesAt​(int id, double time, boolean isGreedy)
      Factory method to simulate a Customer arriving at the specified time, with the specified ID and greediness.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the customer.
      time - Time of arrival of the customer.
      isGreedy - Boolean to check if the customer is a greedy customer.
      Returns:
      new Customer initialised according to the arguments of this method.

    • serverRest

      public static Customer serverRest​(double time, int serverID)
      Simulates a SERVER_REST event.
      Parameters:
      time - Time at which the server starts resting.
      serverID - ID of the server currently resting.
      Returns:
      SERVER_REST event for the specified server at the specified time.

    • serverBack

      public static Customer serverBack​(double time, int serverID)
      Simulates a SERVER_BACK event.
      Parameters:
      time - Time at which the server has finished resting and is available for service.
      serverID - ID of the server which has finished resting.
      Returns:
      SERVER_BACK event for the specified server at the specified time.

    • servedByServer

      public Customer servedByServer​(int serverID)
      Returns a Customer that has been served immediately by the specified server.
      Parameters:
      serverID - ID of the server serving the customer.
      Returns:
      Customer with the state SERVED at the time which the customer will be served.

    • servedBySelfCheck

      public Customer servedBySelfCheck​(int serverID, int waitingID)
      Returns a Customer that has been served immediately by the specified self-check counter.
      Parameters:
      serverID - ID of the self-check counter serving the customer.
      waitingID - ID of the first self-check counter.
      Returns:
      Customer with the state SERVED at the time which the customer will be served.

    • waitsForServer

      public Customer waitsForServer​(int serverID)
      Returns a Customer who is waiting for the specified server.
      Parameters:
      serverID - ID of the server which the Customer is waiting for.
      Returns:
      Customer with the state WAITS at the time specified, waiting for the server with the ID corresponding to serverID.

    • waitsForSelfCheck

      public Customer waitsForSelfCheck​(int waitingID)
      Returns a customer who is waiting for the specified self-check counter.
      Parameters:
      waitingID - ID of the first self-check counter.
      Returns:
      Customer with the state WAITS at the time specified, waiting for the server specified in waitingID. The ID of the actual counter serving the customer may differ from the waitingID.

    • servedLaterAtTime

      public Customer servedLaterAtTime​(double servedTime)
      Returns a customer who will be served at the time specified in the arguments.
      Parameters:
      servedTime - The time at which the customer will be served at.
      Returns:
      Customer with the state SERVED with the time specified.

    • servedLaterAtTimeBySelfCheck

      public Customer servedLaterAtTimeBySelfCheck​(double servedTime, int serverID)
      Returns a customer who will be served by a self-check counter at the time specified in the arguments.
      Parameters:
      servedTime - The time at which the customer will be served at.
      serverID - The ID of the self-check counter serving the customer.
      Returns:
      Customer with the state SERVED with the time specified.

    • doneServingAt

      public Customer doneServingAt​(double completedTime)
      Serves the customer, returning a customer with the state DONE at the given time when the customer has been fully served.
      Parameters:
      completedTime - Time at which the customer has been fully served.
      Returns:
      Customer with the state done at the time which the customer has been fully served.

    • leaves

      public Customer leaves()
      Returns a Customer who leaves immediately as the Customer is unable to be served.
      Returns:
      Customer with the state LEAVES at the same time.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
